    • Method Detail

      • evaluateScoreTemperature

        public java.lang.String evaluateScoreTemperature(int score,
                                                 int temperature)
        Evaluates the score of an individual in a game and the temperature in the room.
        Parameters:
        score - represents the score
        temperature - represents the temperature
        Returns:
        "It's hot out, and so am I" when the score is equal or greater than 10 and the temperature is equal or greater than 35. Otherwise, returns "I'm in a bad mood" when the the score is less than 5 or the temperature is equal or lower than 20. In all other situations, it returns ""I'm balanced".

      • evaluateIfCouldBeAcceptedAtDisco

        public java.lang.String evaluateIfCouldBeAcceptedAtDisco(int dressStyle,
                                                         int talkSkill)
        Evaluates if a person can be accepted to enter in a disco
        Parameters:
        dressStyle - Classification of dress style from 0 to 10
        talkSkill - Classification of talking skills from 0 to 10
        Returns:
        "Accepted" if the dressStyle is equal or higher than 8 and the talkSkill is equal or higher than 5. Otherwise, returns "Not Accepted".
